definition: do not worry about scarcity, but rather about uneven distribution (idiom, from Analects)
pinyin: bu4 huan4 gua3 er2 huan4 bu4 jun1

to suffer (from illness)/to contract (a disease)/misfortune/trouble/danger/worry
few/scant/widowed

Look out for yourself, or heaven and earth will combine to destroy you./Every man for himself, and the Devil take the hindmost.

definition: the rich man cannot be benevolent (idiom, from Mencius). It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven (Matthew 19:24).
to hate the rich
What you don't want done to you, don't do to others. (idiom, from the Confucian analects)/Do as you would be done by./Do not do to others what you would not have them do to you.
pinyin: ji3 suo3 bu4 yu4 , wu4 shi1 yu2 ren2

definition: steal a hook and they hang you, steal the whole country and they make you a prince (idiom, from Daoist classic Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子)
pinyin: qie4 gou1 zhe3 zhu1 , qie4 guo2 zhe3 hou2

definition: poor and with low expectations/poverty stunts ambition
the benevolent man cannot be rich (idiom, from Mencius). It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven (Matthew 19:24).
A just cause attracts much support, an unjust one finds little (idiom, from Mencius)
pinyin: de2 dao4 duo1 zhu4 , shi1 dao4 gua3 zhu4

definition: only the official is allowed to light the fire/Gods may do what cattle may not/quod licet Iovi, non licet bovi

related.word: 只许州官放火，不许百姓点灯

definition: lit. human beings will die for riches, just as birds will for food (idiom)/fig. man will do anything in his means to become rich
pinyin: ren2 wei4 cai2 si3 , niao3 wei4 shi2 wang2

definition: He who gives no thought to far-flung problems soon finds suffering nearby (idiom, from Analects)./Smug concentration on the here and now will lead to future sorrow.
pinyin: ren2 wu2 yuan3 lu:4 , bi4 you3 jin4 you1

definition: lit. the butt governs the head (idiom)/fig. where one stands depends on where one sits/one's views are shaped by one's circumstances
pinyin: pi4 gu5 jue2 ding4 nao3 dai5

definition: one word says it all (idiom, from Analects); to cut a long story short/in a nutshell
to thrive in calamity and perish in soft living (idiom)/life springs from sorrow and calamity, death comes from ease and pleasure
pinyin: sheng1 yu2 you1 huan4 , si3 yu2 an1 le4

definition: a man who is never content is like a snake trying to swallow an elephant (idiom)
pinyin: ren2 xin1 bu4 zu2 she2 tun1 xiang4

definition: scholars tend to disparage one another (idiom)
